meanings.definition: To make a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The old door was skreeghing loudly in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The brakes on the car were skreeghing as it came to a sudden stop.
meanings.sent3: The cat started skreeghing when it saw its reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The microphone was skreeghing with feedback during the concert.
meanings.sent5: The rusty gate kept skreeghing every time it was opened.

meanings.sent1: The skreeghing of the seagulls filled the air at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The skreeghing of the chalk on the blackboard was unbearable.
meanings.sent3: The skreeghing of the violin made everyone cover their ears.
meanings.sent4: The skreeghing of the brakes echoed through the quiet street.
meanings.sent5: The skreeghing of the hinges signaled the arrival of the old ship.
